info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 6 at 1:08AM MDT until June 6 at 4:15AM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following county, Mesa.
* WHEN...Until 415 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.4 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Junction, Palisade, Fruitvale, Clifton, Orchard Mesa and Redlands. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING
